Footer_Description: Professional tattoo studio in Obernburg am Main, Germany. Specialized in Realistic, Traditional, and Blackwork tattoos. Art on skin since 2015.
Home_AboutText1: Welcome to Klod Tattoo: Where art is not just observed... it's worn.
Home_AboutText2: Every line, every shadow, and every detail is born from a thoughtful vision, individually crafted for you. I don't create "standard" tattoos: Each project is a unique artwork that tells your story with style, strength, and elegance.
Home_AboutEducation: My training begins at the Art High School and is perfected at the Academy of Fine Arts, where I turned drawing into a true aesthetic discipline.
Home_AboutCreative: Today, every tattoo I create is not just an image on your skin, but a creative collaboration in which we bring your ideas to life with cutting-edge techniques and unmatched artistic sensibility.
Home_Quote: Your skin is the canvas, my art is the language, and together we create a masterpiece that speaks of who you truly are.
Home_Style_Realistic_Desc: Portraits and photographic details with surgical precision.
Home_Style_Traditional_Desc: Bold lines and vivid colors from the old-school tradition.
Home_Style_Blackwork_Desc: Strong contrasts, geometries, and designs with powerful visual impact.

Info_Aftercare_Desc: Follow these steps carefully for optimal healing and to preserve your tattoo's quality.
Info_Aftercare_Step1_Desc: Gently remove the protective bandage and wash with lukewarm water and unscented soap.
Info_Aftercare_Step2_Desc: Clean 2-3 times daily with unscented soap and pat dry with a clean paper towel.
Info_Aftercare_Step3_Desc: After washing, let your tattoo air dry. Don't cover it unless necessary.
Info_Aftercare_Step4_Desc: Use a thin layer of fragrance-free moisturizer 2-3 times daily. Don't over-moisturize!
Info_Aftercare_Step5_Desc: No swimming, soaking, or prolonged water exposure for 2-3 weeks.
Info_Aftercare_Step6_Desc: Contact us immediately if you notice excessive redness, swelling, or discharge.
Info_Tips_Do1: Keep your tattoo clean and moisturized
Info_Tips_Do3: Wear loose, breathable clothing over the tattoo
Info_Tips_Do5: Contact us with any concerns or questions
Info_Tips_Dont1: Don't pick, scratch, or peel scabs
Info_Tips_Dont2: Don't expose to direct sunlight or tanning beds
Info_Tips_Dont3: Don't swim in pools, oceans, or hot tubs
Info_Tips_Dont5: Don't wear tight or abrasive clothing
Info_Medical_Text: If you experience excessive swelling, severe pain, pus, fever, or red streaks around the tattoo, contact a doctor immediately.
Info_FAQ_Subtitle: Find answers to common questions about tattoos and our services
Info_FAQ_Q1: How much does a tattoo hurt?
Info_FAQ_A1_1: Pain levels vary depending on the location, size, and your personal pain tolerance. Generally, areas with more muscle and fat are less painful, while bony areas (ribs, ankles, elbows) can be more sensitive.
Info_FAQ_A1_2: Most clients describe it as manageable discomfort rather than intense pain. We work at your pace and take breaks as needed to ensure your comfort.
Info_FAQ_A2_Intro: Tattoo pricing depends on several factors:
Info_FAQ_A2_List1: Size and complexity of the design
Info_FAQ_A2_Note: We provide free consultations where we can give you an accurate quote based on your specific design and requirements.
Info_FAQ_Q3: Can I bring a friend to my appointment?
Info_FAQ_Q3_A3_1: Yes! You're welcome to bring one person for support during your session. We ask that they remain respectful and quiet to maintain a focused working environment.
Info_FAQ_Q3_A3_2: Please inform us in advance if you'll be bringing someone so we can ensure we have adequate space.
Info_FAQ_A4_Intro: Yes, you can reschedule with the following conditions:
Info_FAQ_A4_List1: At least 48 hours notice required for free rescheduling
Info_FAQ_A4_List2: Late cancellations or no-shows will forfeit the deposit
Info_FAQ_Q5: Can I bring my own design?
Info_FAQ_A5_1: Absolutely! We love working with your ideas. You can bring reference images, sketches, or a complete design concept.
Info_FAQ_A5_2: During our consultation, we'll work together to refine the design and make any necessary adjustments to ensure it looks perfect as a tattoo.
